      • executeNamedQuery

        public List<T> executeNamedQuery(String namedQuery,
                        String parameterName,
                        Object parameter)
        Execute a given NamedQuery with one Parameter. An example call: Usertable ut = usertableFacade.executeNamedQuery("Usertable.findByIdItem","userId","Igel").get(0); This would search for the entity with the name 'Igel'.
        Parameters:
        NamedQuery - The Queries are defined in the given EntityBean e.g. Usertable.findByIdItem in Usertable
        parameterName - The Name of the perameter in the namedQuery e.g. idItem
        parameter - The value of the parameter. In this example an id: e.g. 1
        Returns:
        ResultList

      • executeNamedQuery

        public List<T> executeNamedQuery(String namedQuery)
        This method is for namedQueries without parameters.
        Parameters:
        NamedQuery - The Queries are defined in the given EntityBean
        Returns:
        ResultList
